intro: How many times do your shoes come untied in a day? Keep your shoes tied ALL day with this simple hack. Bonus: No Annoying Double-Knot to pick at the end of the day. Seriously, no more retying during the big game; no more retying running to catch your ride; no more retying in the hall at work or school. (No more retying your kids shoes.) One simple tie, and your shoes stay tied all day. And, when you are ready to take your shoes off, untying is simple - no more knot picking.
intro_items: How many times do your shoes come untied in a day? Keep your shoes tied ALL day with this simple hack. Bonus: No Annoying Double-Knot to pick at the end of the day.

Seriously, no more retying during the big game; no more retying running to catch your ride; no more retying in the hall at work or school. (No more retying your kids shoes.) One simple tie, and your shoes stay tied all day. And, when you are ready to take your shoes off, untying is simple - no more knot picking.
materiaux:
Supplies
  • Shoes with laces
  • Yourself - and your previous knowledge of how to tie shoes.

etapes.html:
1. Step 1: Cross, Loop, & Tighten

Étapes :

    • Start with untied laces
    • Cross, loop, and tighten the laces - as you would normally when tying your shoes.

2. Step 2: Rabbit Ear & Loop - Then PAUSE

Étapes :

  1. * If you are a double rabbit ear person, this works for you too - simply PAUSE before tightening the "Bow" and proceed to the HACK below.
  2. **I am left-handed. You loop and cross as suits you.
    • Make one rabbit ear and loop the opposite lace around - as you would normally when tying your shoes
    • Push the lace through (as normal) - PAUSE when you have the “Bow” ready to tighten

3. Step 3: THE HACK

Étapes :

    • Instead of pulling the “Bow” tight - take the newest side of the bow and loop it around and through AGAIN.

4. Step 4: Pull the Bow Tight & Live Your Life!

Étapes :

  1. BONUS: You can untie easily by pulling on the strings, but your shoes won’t come untied without pulling.
    • Now, pull the “Bow” tight and Live Your Life...without stopping to retie!
